front.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the place where two areas of air of different temperatures meet, often shown as a line on weather maps
front.translation[0].definitions[0].note: warm/cold front (=an area of warm or cold air)
front.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a legal business that someone operates in order to hide the illegal activities that they are involved in
front.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The casino was used as a front for cross-border smuggling operations.
front.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if you put on a front, you behave in a way that is happier, braver etc than you really feel
front.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: His arrogance is just a front. Deep down he’s really insecure.
When disciplining children, it is important that parents present a united front  (=show that they both feel the same about a situation).
Jenny didn’t want Adam to see how worried she was. So she put on a brave front.
front.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: used in the name of a political party or unofficial military organization
front.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the area where fighting happens in a war
front.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: He joined the army, and was immediately sent to the front.
Her husband was shot down over the Western Front.
front.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a side of a large important church building
front.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: the west front of Rouen cathedral
front.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: at, on, or in the front of something
front.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Two of his front teeth had been knocked out.
the front wheel of his bicycle
We walked up the front steps and into the reception area.
We got there an hour early in order to get seats in the front row.
front.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a front organization is a legal one that is run in order to hide a secret or illegal activity
front.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: a front organization for importing heroin
front.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a front vowel sound is made by raising your tongue at the front of your mouth, such as the vowel sound in ‘see’
front.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: if someone fronts something such as a musical group or a television programme, they lead it and are the person that the public sees most
front.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: Fronted by Alan Hull, the band had a number of memorable hits.
front.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: if a building or area of land is fronted by something, or fronts onto it, it faces that thing
front.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The house was fronted by a large ornamental lake.
The hotel entrance fronted onto a busy road.
front.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a person, organization, system etc used to hide something secret or illegal
front.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: His family kept a shop as a front for dealing in stolen goods.
front.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: used to talk about something in relation to money, inflation, employment etc
front.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: There is a slight improvement on the jobs front with 30% of directors saying they expect to recruit more this year.
front.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: more successful than other people or organizations in a business or activity
front.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: The Data System is just part of a massive development programme to keep us in front and to offer our clients the best licensed taxi service there is.
front.translation[3].definitions[3].defi: to have to see someone in authority because you have done something wrong
front.translation[3].definitions[3].exam: My whole section was called in front of the manager.
front.translation[3].definitions[4].defi: if you pay for something up front, you pay for it before you receive it
front.translation[3].definitions[4].exam: You have to pay a lot up front before you start getting the benefits of the system.
front.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: to lead an organization because you are the person with the highest rank
front.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: The group’s European operation is fronted by Peter Collins.
